text.snippet: End your next meeting efficiently with these 7 tips
header: Don't let a good meeting go
text.paragraph1: Meetings require a lot of time and energy, so it's important to wrap them up as effectively as possible.
text.paragraph2: Make a mistake in these last few minutes, and you risk wasting your efforts as well as your employees' time. To help make sure your next meeting meets its objectives, read "The 7 Worst Ways to End a Meeting."
text.quickTip: Have a "closing round" allowing people to talk for 30 seconds each at the end of your meeting. This can prevent counter-productive side meetings that can derail your progress.
